qas.question: What are poultry eggs used for aside from consumption?

answers.text: Many vaccines to infectious diseases can be grown in fertilised chicken eggs.

qas.question: What is the major difficulty faced in using poultry to cultivate vaccines?

answers.text: egg allergies are unable to be immunised

qas.question: How long does it take for the flu vaccine to be fully ready for deployment into the population ?

answers.text: process that takes about six months

qas.question: In order to make a vaccine , what do viruses require that bacteria does not?

answers.text: viruses need living cells in which to replicate

qas.question: What new technology is being used in teh vaccine making process that will make vaccines safer and eaier for most consumers?

plausible_answers.text: Many vaccines to infectious diseases can be grown in fertilised chicken eggs

qas.question: Why are poultry eggs useless aside from consumption?

plausible_answers.text: Millions of eggs are used each year to generate the annual flu vaccine requirements

qas.question: Why is there no difficulty faced in using poultry to cultivate vaccines?
What do viruses need in order to replicate in the laboratory?
What is a simple process that takes about one month to prepare?
What food is least commonly associated with allergy?

context: Bacteria can be grown in the laboratory on <b7_0>nutrient culture media<b7_0/>, but <a3_0>viruses need living cells in which to replicate<a3_0/>. <a0_0><b5_0>Many vaccines to infectious diseases can be grown in fertilised chicken eggs<b5_0/>.<a0_0/> <b6_0>Millions of eggs are used each year to generate the <b8_0>annual flu vaccine requirements<b8_0/><b6_0/>, a complex <a2_0>process that takes about six months<a2_0/> after the decision is made as to what strains of virus to include in the new vaccine. A problem with using eggs for this purpose is that people with <a1_0><b9_0>egg<b9_0/> allergies are unable to be immunised<a1_0/>, but this disadvantage may be overcome as new techniques for cell-based rather than egg-based culture become available<a4_0>. Cell-based culture<a4_0/> will also be useful in a pandemic when it may be difficult to acquire a sufficiently large quantity of suitable sterile, fertile eggs.
